alert.note: Alert for Burleigh (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 5:49PM CDT until June 24 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central North Dakota, including the following counties, Burleigh and McLean. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 547 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in northern Burleigh and southeast McLean Counties. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of a half to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Johns Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
